info.name: Bolt APIs
info.description:
## About

The Bolt API handles [order token creation](/developers/guides/custom-cart-guides/how-to-integrate/create-bolt-order-token/), [transaction actions](/merchants/guides/dashboard/view-transactions/), and [statements](/merchants/references/financials/statements/) generated for merchants using Bolt Payments.

Note: You must also reference the [Merchant API](/api-merchant) when building a custom cart integration

* * *

You can add additional instructions/documentation here. This will stay in sync, even if you update the API spec and collection

header.description: The publicly viewable identifier used to identify a merchant division. This key is found in the Developer > API section of the Bolt Merchant Dashboard [RECOMMENDED].

variable.description: (Required) The ID for an address in the shopper's Address Book.

request.description: Deletes an existing address in a shopper's address book.

The publicly viewable identifier used to identify a merchant division. This key is found in the Developer > API section of the Bolt Merchant Dashboard [RECOMMENDED].

header.description: The publicly viewable identifier used to identify a merchant division. This key is found in the Developer > API section of the Bolt Merchant Dashboard [RECOMMENDED].

request.description: Fetch a shopper's account details to pre-fill checkout fields. This request must come from your backend for security purposes, as it requires the use of your private key to authenticate. For PCI compliance, only limited information is returned for each credit card available in the shopperâ€™s wallet.

response.name: Account Created

  "save": true
}

request.description:
Add a payment method to a shopper's Bolt account Wallet. For security purposes, this request must come from your backend because authentication requires the use of your private key.

**Note**: Before using this API, the credit card details must be tokenized using Bolt's JavaScript library function, which is documented in [Install the Bolt Tokenizer](https://help.bolt.com/developers/references/bolt-tokenizer).

response.name: Payment Method Added

query.description: (Required) The unique ID associated to the merchant's Bolt Account division; Merchants can have different divisions to suit multiple use cases (storefronts, pay-by-link, phone order processing). You can view and switch between these divisions from the Bolt Merchant Dashboard.

request.description: Retrieves callbacks URLs for a Bolt merchant division.

response.name: Merchant Callbacks Retrieved

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

response.name: BAD REQUEST. Request is malformed or invalid values are detected. division_id could be invalid.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

response.name: Invalid Merchant API Key

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

request.description: Configure callbacks URLs for a Bolt merchant division. This will store or override only the callback URLs that are specified in the request. Operations are fully transactional.

response.name: Successfully sets callback URLs. No JSON schema is expected.

response.name: BAD REQUEST. Request is malformed or invalid values are detected. division_id could be invalid.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

(Required) Unique 12-16 digit for every request. Is used for deduplication
requests so that if there a network duplication of any API we make sure we don't
capture payment twice or create order twice etc.
The publicly viewable identifier used to identify a merchant division. This key is found in the Developer > API section of the Bolt Merchant Dashboard [RECOMMENDED].

* â€¢ Authorize a payment using a saved payment method.

header.description:
(Required) Unique 12-16 digit for every request. Is used for deduplication
requests so that if there a network duplication of any API we make sure we don't
capture payment twice or create order twice etc.

request.description:
This captures funds for the designated transaction. A capture can be done for any partial amount or for the total authorized amount.

Although the response returns the standard `transaction_view` object, only `captures` and either `id` or `reference` are needed.

response.name: Capture Successful

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

requests so that if there a network duplication of any API we make sure we don't
capture payment twice or create order twice etc.

request.description: This refunds a captured transaction. Refunds can be done for any partial amount or for the total authorized amount. Refunds are processed synchronously and return information about the refunded transaction in the standard `transaction_view` object.

response.name: Refund Successful

request.description:
This voids the authorization for a given transaction. Voids must be completed before the authorization is captured.

Although the response returns the standard `transaction_view` object, only `status` and either `id` or `reference` are needed.

request.description:
This allows you to pull the full transaction details for a given transaction.

 **Note**: All objects and fields marked `required` in the Transaction Details response are also **nullable**. This includes any sub-components (objects or fields) also marked `required`.

response.name: Transaction Details Retrieved

request.description: Send the carrier and order tracking number to Bolt (after a label has been printed). Bolt then uses EasyPost to forward ongoing tracking event updates to the shopper. This request must include **all** items included in the shipment; their references must also match those found in the original cart generation.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
The publicly viewable identifier used to identify a merchant division. This key is found in the Developer > API section of the Bolt Merchant Dashboard [RECOMMENDED].

request.description:
Endpoint for receiving access, ID, and refresh tokens from Bolt's OAuth server. 

To use this endpoint, first use the Authorization Code Request flow by using the `authorization_code` Grant Type (`grant_type`). Then, in the event that you would need a second or subsequent code, use the `refresh_token` value returned from a successful request as the `refresh_token` input value in your subsequent `refresh_token` Grant Type (`grant_type`) request.

response.name: OAuth token response.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
The publicly viewable identifier used to identify a merchant division. This key is found in the Developer > API section of the Bolt Merchant Dashboard [RECOMMENDED].

response.body:
{
  "access_token": "$ACCESS_TOKEN",
  "expires_in": 3600,
  "id_token": "$ID_TOKEN",
  "refresh_token": "$REFRESH_TOKEN",
  "refresh_token_scope": "bolt.account.view",
  "scope": "bolt.account.manage openid",
  "token_type": "bearer"
}

response.name: Invalid request to OAuth Token.
